title: Establishing an Emergency Board To Investigate Disputes Between the Long Island Rail Road Company and Certain of Its Employees Represented by Certain Labor Organizations

enrichment.summary: This executive order establishes an Emergency Board to investigate and report on labor disputes between the Long Island Rail Road Company and its employees represented by multiple labor unions. The board will examine the issues, maintain current working conditions temporarily, and provide recommendations within 30 days to help resolve the disputes under federal labor law.
potential_concerns: The temporary freeze on changing work conditions might prolong tensions and disrupt railroad operations affecting commuters and freight.
There may be disagreement over the impartiality and selection of Emergency Board members, potentially undermining trust in the process.
If the board's recommendations are not accepted by either party, the dispute could escalate, leading to strikes or service interruptions.
Costs borne by the Department of Transportation for administration and publication may be viewed as an inefficient use of public funds if the dispute resolution is not successful.
